title: Manzanar National Historic Site: Group Volunteering
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Volunteer     Group Volunteering               Group Volunteering         Los Angeles Community Partners Volunteers NPS PHOTO  Organized groups Organized groups are essential for supporting the NPS mission of preserving natural and cultural resources while providing for the enjoyment and education of this and future generations. Examples of group volunteer community service projects at Manzanar include invasive plant species removal, trail maintenance, brush removal, and various other maintenance duties. There is typically a 5 hour minimum commitment and 2 month advanced notice for service projects as staff is limited. Groups can also participate in some of our big projects and volunteer days we have planned throughout the year. To learn more about our upcoming opportunities, check out Manzanar's Volunteer Days page. For more information on volunteering as an organized group, please contact Carrie Andresen-Strawn. Carrie Andresen-Strawn Park Ranger-Volunteer Coordinator & Youth Engagement Lead Manzanar National Historic Site Phone: 760-878-2194 ext. 3314 Fax: 760-878-2949 carrie_andresen@nps.gov
